plants.name: Helianthus annuus
plants.description: Sunflowers are tall annual plants known for their large, bright yellow flower heads that follow the sun's movement throughout the day. They are widely cultivated for their seeds and oil.
plants.bloomingSeason: Summer to early autumn (July to September)
plants.funFact: Sunflowers can grow to heights over 3 meters and their flower heads can be over 30 cm in diameter!

plants.name: Hibiscus rosa-sinensis
plants.description: A tropical shrub or small tree with large, showy flowers often cultivated as an ornamental plant. Flowers are trumpet-shaped and can be found in various colors.
plants.bloomingSeason: Year-round in tropical climates, including August
plants.location: Tropical Asia, Pacific Islands, widely cultivated in tropical and subtropical regions
plants.funFact: Each hibiscus flower lasts only a day, but the plant blooms continuously during its season.

plants.name: Rudbeckia hirta
plants.description: A North American native wildflower with bright yellow petals surrounding a dark brown cone-shaped center. Often found in meadows and prairies.
plants.bloomingSeason: Summer to early fall (July to September)
plants.funFact: The Black-eyed Susan is the state flower of Maryland.

plants.name: Protea cynaroides
plants.description: The national flower of South Africa, the King Protea has large, distinctive flower heads with spiky pink and white bracts resembling a crown.
plants.bloomingSeason: Winter to spring in South Africa (July to October), blooming still visible in August
plants.funFact: The King Protea is named after the Greek god Proteus, symbolizing its diverse forms.
